CatDescriptText: Walter Fearby, commercial artist, North Side and Barbara Williams, postal worker, Hill District, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in the Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, October 1, 1960, pg. A1 with question "Do you think that the military strength for defense of the United States is adequate enough like Presidential candidate Richard Nixon declares it is, or do you believe that it is not strong enough, and needs strengthening, like Presidential candidate John Kennedy says it is?"  Mr. Fearby's answer reads: "Right now, I think we are strong enough.  For instance, I see fellows going into the service every day.  My opinion doesn't necessarily mean I'm a Nixon backer."  Ms. William's answer reads: "I agree with Kennedy that military defense needs strengthening."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Walter Fearby wearing polo shirt and eyeglasses, standing at intersection of Smithfield Street and Liberty Avenue, Downtown; Portrait of Barbara Williams wearing eyeglasses and shirt with ruffled button placket, standing in front of store window
